--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Kenneth Stanley" <kstanley@c...> wrote:

> It's possible these are just disabled connections- I'm not sure what 
> the specific settings of the system are but the connections may have 
> become randomly disabled.  You need to look at the actual textual 
> description of the genome (loadable in Ugo's third panel) and see 
> what the genome actually contains.   I believe JNEAT is sound; other 
> people have used it to evolve other things like control networks 
> successfully.   If Ugo is reading here he may have further insight.  
> 
> ken
> 
I have the same opinion of Ken: is possible that during the several
ones it is made of crossing, mutation etc a gene becomes disabled for
which it turns out ' appeso': only thing to make is to see if some the
link disabled from/to that node in the part of description of the
genome exists; 

The application in any case manages more serious cases like as an
example nets that do not have more unit than out because of link
disabled or mutations

          Ugo
